snippet: As two Obama officials all but endorsed same-sex marriage, new pressure was placed on the president to take a definitive stance on the issue.
abstract: Pres Obama faces renewed pressure to take a clear stand on same-sex marriage despite the unpredictable consequences it may have for his re-election bid; push comes as North Carolina is set to vote on a constitutional amendment banning it and Colorado advocates of civil unions are seeking to push a measure through the State Legislature; Education Secretary Arne Duncan voices his support for same-sex marriage.

byline.contributor: Dan Frosch contributed reporting from Denver, and Campbell Robertson from New Orleans.

lead_paragraph: As two Obama officials all but endorsed same-sex marriage, new pressure was placed on the president to take a definitive stance on the issue.
